intro: Aster brachytrichus var. tenuiligulatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved aster, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wet meadows. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are usually blue to purple in color. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native range.
